poem:
Title: In Anticipation of an Ending

Ava, Anna, seeking tomorrow's echo
On The Spit's silvered edge,
Where The Wave promises consummation.
Two women marked by absence— 
A daughter devoured by hunger, 
And flesh traded in twilight groves.
In The After, we parse our losses, 
Etch hope to an ending world. 

Bittersweet, the way we crave 
What leads us, in the end, to absence.
prompt: You are the poet Jericho Brown. You woke up this morning feeling nostalgic. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Ava Anna Ada by Ali Millar review – at the end of the world The world is coming to an end. In a period known as The After, on a coastal area called The Spit, Ava and Anna are waiting for The Wave. Ava, a young woman who sells sex in the woods, is obsessed with Anna: older, wealthier, an influencer and kept wife who has recently lost her daughter Ada to anorexia. Both Anna". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
